summaries.summary: This file outlines the community standards and code of conduct for project contributors and participants. It emphasizes creating a harassment-free environment, addresses acceptable and unacceptable behaviors, and defines enforcement guidelines for violations.

A Japanese README file introducing the OpenManus project, including installation instructions, contribution guidelines, and community resources. It highlights the project's goals, team members, and related tools like OpenManus-RL.

functions.name: MCPRunner.initialize
functions.purpose: Initialize the MCP agent with a specified connection type (stdio/sse) and server URL.

functions.name: MCPRunner.run_interactive
functions.purpose: Run the agent in an interactive prompt mode for user input.

functions.name: MCPRunner.run_single_prompt
functions.purpose: Execute a single user prompt and exit.

functions.name: parse_args
functions.purpose: Parse command-line arguments for connection type, server URL, and mode (interactive/prompt).

summaries.summary: This script runs the MCP (Model Context Protocol) agent with support for interactive, single-prompt, or default modes. It initializes the agent, handles user input, and cleans up resources upon exit.

functions.name: get_project_root
functions.purpose: Determine the project's root directory path.

functions.name: Config.__init__
functions.purpose: Load configuration from a toml file and initialize settings using Pydantic models.

summaries.summary: This module handles application configurations using Pydantic models. It loads settings from a toml file, managing LLM API keys, browser settings, search engines, and MCP configurations. It uses a singleton pattern for the Config class to ensure global access.
This file checks the Python version (requires 3.11-3.13) and prints a warning if an incompatible version is detected.

CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md.summary: This file outlines the community standards and code of conduct for project contributors and participants. It emphasizes creating a harassment-free environment, addresses acceptable and unacceptable behaviors, and defines enforcement guidelines for violations.

README_ja.md.summary: A Japanese README file introducing the OpenManus project, including installation instructions, contribution guidelines, and community resources. It highlights the project's goals, team members, and related tools like OpenManus-RL.

functions.name: MCPRunner.initialize
functions.purpose: Initialize the MCP agent with a specified connection type (stdio/sse) and server URL.

functions.name: MCPRunner.run_interactive
functions.purpose: Run the agent in an interactive prompt mode for user input.

functions.name: MCPRunner.run_single_prompt
functions.purpose: Execute a single user prompt and exit.

functions.name: parse_args
functions.purpose: Parse command-line arguments for connection type, server URL, and mode (interactive/prompt).

run_mcp.py.summary: This script runs the MCP (Model Context Protocol) agent with support for interactive, single-prompt, or default modes. It initializes the agent, handles user input, and cleans up resources upon exit.

functions.name: get_project_root
functions.purpose: Determine the project's root directory path.

functions.name: Config.__init__
functions.purpose: Load configuration from a toml file and initialize settings using Pydantic models.

app/config.py.summary: This module handles application configurations using Pydantic models. It loads settings from a toml file, managing LLM API keys, browser settings, search engines, and MCP configurations. It uses a singleton pattern for the Config class to ensure global access.

app/__init__.py.summary: This file checks the Python version (requires 3.11-3.13) and prints a warning if an incompatible version is detected.
